Notifications

Resource for handling interaction with existing user notifications

new Notifications(discourse: Discourse)
Parameters
discourse (Discourse) A Discourse class instance through which API calls are made.
Static Members
▸ Notification
Notification

Type: Object

Properties
id (number) : The Notification ID
notification_type (number) : The type of the notification
read (boolean)
created_at (string)
post_number (number)
topic_id (number)
fancy_title (string)
slug (string)
data (Object)
  • data.topic_title string
  • data.original_post_id number
  • data.original_post_type number
  • data.original_username string
  • data.revision_number number?
  • data.display_username string
▸ NotificationResponse
NotificationResponse

Type: Object

Properties
notifications (Array<Notification>) : An array of notifications
seen_notification_id (number) : The ID of the last seen notification
Instance Members
▸ get(inputs = {})

Get a list of notifications for the authenticated user.

get(inputs: Object?): Promise<NotificationResponse>
Parameters
inputs (Object? = {}) Optional URL parameters
Name Description
inputs.recent boolean Whether or not to only show recent notifications
inputs.limit number The number of notifications to show. Only works if recent is true
Returns
Promise<NotificationResponse>: The API response
Example
discourse.notifications.get({
  recent: true,
})
.then(res => console.log(res))
.catch(err => console.log(err));
▸ markRead(body = {})

Mark a single notification, or all notifications as read.

If no notification ID is provided then all notifications will be marked as read. If a notification ID is provided, that specific notification will be marked as read.

markRead(body: Object?): Promise<TBC>
Parameters
body (Object? = {}) Optional request body
Name Description
body.id number ID of the notification to mark read
Returns
Promise<TBC>: The API response
Example
discourse.notifications.markRead({
  id: 1201,
})
.then(res => console.log(res))
.catch(err => console.log(err));
